text:
Does this sound pretentious or does it sound in line with Julian values?
<https://github.com/caseykneale/PickingALanguage2020/tree/main/fieldnotes/revisitting_old_things>

elements.text: Does this sound pretentious or does it sound in line with Julian values?

text: I don't know about Julian value (except for being greedy with the tool you use :laughing:), but that reading sound nice. Not pretentious at all.

elements.text: I don't know about Julian value (except for being greedy with the tool you use
), but that reading sound nice. Not pretentious at all.

text: thank you :slightly_smiling_face: I'll share the write up after some touch ups. Always good to get second eyes

elements.text: I'll share the write up after some touch ups. Always good to get second eyes

text: And, I share some of the thoughts you put in there. I need to use Python for works in my school (still in uni), and can relate to miss some of the Julia niceties when writing Python (sometimes i find myself writing Julia code until Python screams at me). (edit: typo)

elements.text: And, I share some of the thoughts you put in there. I need to use Python for works in my school (still in uni), and can relate to miss some of the Julia niceties when writing Python (sometimes i find myself writing Julia code until Python screams at me). (edit: typo)

text: Still thing Python is a great language, but I feel like Julia fits better a lot of the work that I need to do. And exactly that message is what I understood from the reading. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Still thing Python is a great language, but I feel like Julia fits better a lot of the work that I need to do. And exactly that message is what I understood from the reading.

text:
Small Typo at the end:
"Unless I have too"
Interesting read :+1:
